dt: {bc}a utensil that is usually a hollow cone with a tube extending from the smaller end and that is designed to catch and direct a downward flow
{bc}a stack or flue for the escape of smoke or for ventilation (as on a ship)

et: Middle English {it}funell, fonel,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French {it}fonyle,{/it} borrowed from Old Occitan (Gascony, Périgord) {it}fonilh,{/it} going back to early Medieval Latin {it}fundibulum{/it}, shortened from Latin {it}infundibulum,{/it} from {it}infundere{/it} "to pour in, fill (with something poured in)" + {it}-i-{/it} {et_link|-i-|-i-} + {it}-bulum,{/it} instrumental suffix (going back to Indo-European {it}*-d{sup}h{/sup}lom{/it}) {ma}{mat|infuse|}{/ma}

As noted by {it}Französisches etymologisches Wörterbuch,{/it} the incidence of this Occitan word in English (and Anglo-French) is most likely due to commercial contacts between England and the wine merchants of the Bordeaux region.
shortdef: a utensil that is usually a hollow cone with a tube extending from the smaller end and that is designed to catch and direct a downward flow
a stack or flue for the escape of smoke or for ventilation (as on a ship)

dt: {bc}to have or take the shape of a funnel
{bc}to pass through or as if through a funnel or conduit
{bc}to form in the shape of a funnel

dt.t: {wi}funneled{/wi} his hands and shouted through them

dt: {bc}to move to a focal point or into a conduit or central channel

shortdef: to have or take the shape of a funnel
to pass through or as if through a funnel or conduit
to form in the shape of a funnel

dt: {bc}a funnel-shaped cloud that projects from the base of a thundercloud and that often precedes the formation of a tornado

shortdef: a funnel-shaped cloud that projects from the base of a thundercloud and that often precedes the formation of a tornado; also : tornado
